messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Using the law of attraction
messages.msgSnippet: Peace Ren! First off thank you for the link to the Blog Carnival!  Second, one of the people interviewed in the Secret stated that it is a scientifically
messages.messageBody:
Peace Ren!

First off thank you for the link to the Blog Carnival! Second, one of the people interviewed in the Secret stated that it is a scientifically proven fact that an affirmative statment is MORE powerful than a negative one. What do we have to lose by choosing to think and feel positive?

Much Love
Tyra
From: "Ren Allen" <starsuncloud@...>
Date: 2006/08/31 Thu PM 05:34:40 CDT
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Using the law of attraction

"I was my own worst critic! If we can't be on our own side, then who
can be?? I finally learned to catch that inner critic at work and
replace the knee jerk messages with soothing, positive inner talk.

It's been hugely transformational. Part of it is to phrase everything
as if I already have exactly what it is I desire; "I am successful, I
am brilliant and confident. I have talent, I am a creative genius" etc...

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Using the law of attraction
messages.msgSnippet: The key is that the more you focus on what you want and FEEL IT as if you have, the quicker what you desire comes. Our thoughts are more powerful than we
messages.messageBody:
"The key is that the more you focus on what you want and FEEL IT as if
you have, the quicker what you desire comes."

Our thoughts are more powerful than we realize. At some point during
my own spiritual evolution, I noticed that the natural dialogue in my
head was mostly negative; "I'm not talented enough to do that", "I'm
too disorganized to get ________accomplished", "people will laugh if I
try_________" etc...
DUMB!!
I was my own worst critic! If we can't be on our own side, then who
can be?? I finally learned to catch that inner critic at work and
replace the knee jerk messages with soothing, positive inner talk.

It's been hugely transformational. Part of it is to phrase everything
as if I already have exactly what it is I desire; "I am successful, I
am brilliant and confident. I have talent, I am a creative genius" etc...

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
